category: Substances that Extinguish Wind and Stop Tremors

action.primary: Extinguishes Wind and stops spasms and convulsions

indications: Seizures due to Liver Wind or especially Wind-Phlegm-Heat

action.primary: Dispels Wind, disperses Wind-Heat and stops itching and pain

indications: Headache, red eyes, a sore, swollen throat and itching skin lesions such as Wind-Rash from externally contracted Wind-Heat or Liver Wind

action.primary: Transforms Phlegm, softens hardness, eliminates toxins and dissipates nodules

indications: Phlegm-Heat scrofula and other Phlegm nodules

contraindications: Contraindicated when there are no externally contracted pathogenic factors.
incompatibilities: Antagonizes Rz. Dioscoreae Hypoglaucae #{BeiXie} Bei Xie.
Antagonizes Ootheca Mantidis #{SangPiaoXiao} Sang Piao Xiao.

useCases: Seizures and convulsions due to Phlegm Heat.
Febrile convulsions.
Quickly developing convulsions with generalized twitching and wheezing.
Convulsions with Phlegm and Fire.
Chronic childhood convulsions due to chronic diarrhea associated with Spleen Deficiency.
Tetany with opisthotonis.
Muscular tetany.
Mouth and eyes awry from Wind attacking the channels and collaterals.
Epileptic seizures.
Headache with red eyes.
Headache, red, swollen eyes and tearing from drafts due to Wind-Heat attacking the Liver channel.
Hoarseness and painful, red throat due to Wind-Heat.
Itchy skin associated with Wind-Rash.
Scrofula and other Phlegm nodules.
Mastitis, mumps and deep-seated sores and abscesses.
Frontal headache.
Eczema or rash due to Wind.
Paralysis, involuntary facial twitching or facial paralysis.
Headache due to Liver Yang Rising.
Sore throat and a hoarse voice.
Toxic nodules.
Childhood convulsions with night crying and fear.
As a powder for stubborn, pounding headaches that resemble a hammer striking the head.
